name: The Fantastic Four (Volume 1) - The Early Years Online Trivia | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: The original members of the Fantastic four were Mr. Fantastic, Invisible Girl, Human Torch and Thing.  What were their real names?
questions.correct: Reed Richards, Susan Storm, Johnny Storm and Ben Grimm
options: Stephen Strange, Brunnhilde, Bobby Drake and Norrin Radd
Steve Rogers, Janet vanDyne, Bruce Banner and Tony Stark
Scott Summers, Jean Grey, Hank McCoy and Warren Worthington III
questions.explanation:
Reed Richards, Susan Storm, Johnny Storm and Ben Grimm.

	Created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, the team debuted in 'Fantastic Four' (vol.1) #1 in 1961.  It would be 24 years later (1985) before Sue would demand to be called the Invisible Woman.

questions.text: How did the four original members of the Fantastic Four receive their powers?
questions.explanation:
Exposure to cosmic rays.

	The quartet take a rocket ship into outer space, and its ship does not shield them from a bombardment of cosmic rays.

questions.text: In 'Fantastic Four' #22 (1964) the Invisible Girl discovers she has more than just the ability to turn invisible.  Which of these other abilities does she exhibit?
questions.correct: Ability to create invisible force fields
options: Ability to mentally cause small explosions
Ability to telepathically link the minds of all four members
Ability to mimic/duplicate the powers of her teammates.
questions.explanation:
Ability to create invisible force fields.

	Sue is able to generate invisible force fields with varying degrees of rigidity and size.  In the same issue she also discovers she is able to temporarily make other people or objects invisible as well.

questions.text: In 'Fantastic Four' Annual #3 (1965), which two team members get married?
options: Invisible Girl and the Human Torch
questions.explanation:
Mr. Fantastic and Invisible Girl

	Reed and Sue had been dating since the series began.  The guest list to their wedding included the X-Men, Avengers, Spider-Man and some Agents of Shield.

questions.text: In 1967 the Invisible Girl announces she is pregnant. The following year she temporarily resigns the team to go on maternity leave.  Who replaces her on the team?
questions.explanation:
Crystal.

	Crystal is one of the royal family of the Inhumans, with the ability to control the four basic elements.  She had been dating the Human Torch and was a semi-regular character in the title prior to joining the team.  Crystal leaves the team in 1970.

questions.text: Which member of the Fantastic Four uses the code name of another hero, with the same powers, whose adventures were published in the 1930s thru 1950s?
questions.explanation:
Human Torch.

	The original Human Torch was the very first superhero published by Timely Comics (which eventually would become Marvel Comics) beginning in 1939.  He was an android whose secret identity was Jim Hammond.

questions.text: After 2 years (comic book time!) of being pregnant, the Invisible Girl gives birth in 'Fantastic Four' Annual #6 in November 1969.  What do she and Mr. Fantastic name their child?
questions.explanation:
Franklin Benjamin Richards.

	Franklin is in honor of his maternal grandfather, and Benjamin is in honor of his godfather Ben (the Thing) Grimm.

questions.text: In 'Fantastic Four' #8 (1962) the Thing meets the woman who will become his long time love interest.  What is her name?
questions.explanation:
Alicia Masters.

	Alicia is a sculptress, and the blind daughter of one of the Fantastic Fours' primary foes, the Puppet Master.

questions.text: In 1973, Reed takes it upon himself to shut down the mind of his mutant son.  Angry over not being consulted, the Invisible Girl takes a marital separation from him, and resigns from the Fantastic Four.  Who replaces her on the team?
questions.explanation:
Medusa.

	Like her sister Crystal, who had previously replaced Sue during her maternity leave, Medusa is a member of the Royal Family of the Inhumans.  Medusa would remain a member of the Fantastic Four for over two years.

questions.text: First introduced in 'Fantastic Four' #48 (1966), Galactus was a god-like being that the team would encounter often.  Who was the herald of Galactus, introduced in the same issue?
questions.explanation:
Silver Surfer.

	The Silver Surfer went on to be an extremely popular Marvel character.  He has been given several volumes of his own self titled comic series, one of them running an impressive 146 issues.
